actions.text: Read second time and referred to Senate Committee on Judiciary.

actions.subcommittee: the Courts; provided that if one Subcommittee reports thereon,then the other shall be discharged fifteen days thereafter, and if neither Subcommittee reports within sixty days, then both shall be discharged from further consideration thereof
actions.text: Committee on Judiciary. actions.text: Committee on Judiciary. Jointly referred to the Subcommittee on Agency Administration; provided that if one Subcommittee reports thereon,then the other shall be discharged fifteen days thereafter, and if neither Subcommittee reports within sixty days, then both shall be discharged from further consideration thereof.
Committee on Judiciary requested executive comment from Office of the Attorney General.

actions.subcommittee: Courts and to the Subcommittee on Agency Administration, modified to extend the period for consideration of the bill from 60 days to 90 days
actions.text: Committee on Judiciary. Jointly referred to the Subcommittee on Courts and to the Subcommittee on Agency Administration, modified to extend the period for consideration of the bill from 60 days to 90 days.

Agency Administration; provided that if one Subcommittee reports thereon,then the other shall be discharged fifteen days thereafter, and if neither Subcommittee reports within sixty days, then both shall be discharged from further consideration thereof
actions.text: Subcommittee on Agency Administration. Hearings held.
Committee on Judiciary. Joint referral is hereby modified to extend the period for consideration of the bill to April 1, 1982.
Committee on Judiciary. Received Memorandum of Law from the Congressional Research Service of the Library of Congress affirming permanency of Section 140 of P.L. 97-92.
Committee on Judiciary received executive comment from Office of the Attorney General.

official_title: A bill to require an annual authorization for the Federal court system excluding the Supreme Court.
short_title: Federal Judicial Salary Control Act of 1981

summary.text: Federal Judicial Salary Control Act of 1981 - Requires appropriations for the Federal judiciary, including funding for representation under the Criminal Justice Act and for the Federal courts (except the Supreme Court), to be specially authorized by Act of Congress. Prohibits increases in compensation for Federal judges, including the Supreme Court, except as specifically authorized by Act of Congress.

titles.title: Federal Judicial Salary Control Act of 1981
A bill to require an annual authorization for the Federal court system excluding the Supreme Court.
